<p> Normal defines a set of 3D surface-normal vectors that apply either to a sibling Coordinate|CoordinateDouble node, or else to a parent ElevationGrid node. Normal values are perpendicular directions that are used per-polygon or per-vertex when computing lighting and shading. </p> <p> X3D Tooltips of interest: <a href="https://www.web3d.org/x3d/tooltips/X3dTooltips.html#Normal" target="_blank">Normal</a>. </p> <p> <a href="https://www.web3d.org/documents/specifications/19775-1/V3.3/Part01/Architecture.html" target="_blank">X3D Specification</a> sections of interest: <a href="https://www.web3d.org/documents/specifications/19775-1/V3.3/Part01/components/rendering.html" target="_blank">11 Rendering component,</a>, <a href="https://www.web3d.org/documents/specifications/19775-1/V3.3/Part01/components/rendering.html#Concepts" target="_blank">11.2 Concepts</a>, <a href="https://www.web3d.org/documents/specifications/19775-1/V3.3/Part01/components/rendering.html#Normals" target="_blank">11.2.2.4 Geometric properties: Normals</a>, <a href="https://www.web3d.org/documents/specifications/19775-1/V3.3/Part01/components/rendering.html#X3DNormalNode" target="_blank">11.3.6 X3DNormalNode</a> and <a href="https://www.web3d.org/documents/specifications/19775-1/V3.3/Part01/components/rendering.html#Normal" target="_blank">11.4.10 Normal</a>. </p> <p> <a href="https://www.web3d.org/x3d/content/examples/X3dResources.html#Examples" target="_blank">X3D Examples Archives</a> of related interest: </p> <ul> <li> VRML 2 Sourcebook:&nbsp; <a href="https://www.web3d.org/x3d/content/examples/Vrml2Sourcebook/Chapter19NormalsShading" target="_blank">Chapter 19 Normals Shading</a> </li> <li> X3D for Web Authors: <a href="http://x3dgraphics.com/examples/X3dForWebAuthors/Chapter13GeometryTrianglesQuadrilaterals" target="_blank">Chapter 13 Geometry Triangles Quadrilaterals</a> </li> </ul>
